intro: Erigeron pachyrhizus, commonly known as the thick-root fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron pachyrhizus is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system that helps it survive in harsh climates.
